intro: Roebuckia chinnockii, commonly known as the Chinnock's roebuckia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a desirable ornamental plant in arid landscapes.
